                </div>
                <div class="vcex-toggle__content wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-my-10 wpex-clr" id="vcex_67ef1648b3914">
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   Title:
                  </strong>
                  NANO-ENGINEERING SEMINAR + PROJECT 3
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   Teacher(s):
                  </strong>
                  Prof. Maria Luisa Di Vona
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   Credits:
                  </strong>
                  2
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   LEARNING OUTCOMES
                  </strong>
                  <br/>
                  The course “Nano-engineering Seminar + Project” is conceived as a forum of exchange for new ideas emerging from the literature and lectures.
                  <br/>
                  The goal is to teach students to work on project, to present its outcome correctly and to be able to defend it. In addition a revision session, where students can express their potential problems and discuss them with other students, under the professor/tutor guidance is planned.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   KNOWLEDGE AND UNDERSTANDING
                  </strong>
                  <br/>
                  To integrate knowledge and handle complexity, and formulate judgments in situations characterized by incomplete or limited information,
                  <br/>
                  To reflect on social and ethical responsibilities linked to the application of their knowledge and judgments;
                  <br/>
                  To acquire the learning skills which allow them to continue to study in a manner that may be largely self-directed or autonomous.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   APPLYING KNOWLEDGE AND UNDERSTANDING
                  </strong>
                  <br/>
                  To apply their knowledge and understanding, in new or unfamiliar environments within broader (or multidisciplinary) contexts related to their field of study;
                  <br/>
                  To communicate their conclusions, the knowledge and rationale underpinning these, to specialist and non-specialist audiences clearly and unambiguously.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   MAKING JUDGEMENTS
                  </strong>
                  <br/>
                  The ability to obtain and describe results from literature data, in order to arrive at the formulation of an interpretative judgment on the results acquired;
                  <br/>
                  The ability to collect and process technical and safety information, taking into account the properties of the subject including any specific risk.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   COMMUNICATION SKILLS
                  </strong>
                  <br/>
                  Direct interaction between researchers and students coming from different countries, with different cultural background will improve the communication skills and increase tolerance.
                  <br/>
                  Their understanding of the foreign cultures and history will allow them for easier contact with people having different cultural background.
                  <br/>
                  The necessity to cooperate with students and professors from different countries and cultures will increase their tolerance and politeness towards strangers.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   LEARNING SKILLS
                  </strong>
                  <br/>
                  Assure an interdisciplinary training in the field of nano-engineering, which includes a profound understanding of the chemistry and the methods of synthesis and characterization of nano-materials and nano-systems.
                  <br/>
                  Capacity to promote and to develop scientific and technological innovation.
                  <br/>
                  Possibility of making a critical analysis of scientific information.
                  <br/>
                  Capacity of technical and economic evaluation of a project of innovation and research.
                  <br/>
                  Capacity to work effectively in a team project.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   PREREQUISITES
                   <br/>
                  </strong>
                  There are no mandatory prerequisites for this course.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   TOPICS
                   <br/>
                  </strong>
                  Introduction to nanoengineering; nanoscale fabrication.
                  <br/>
                  Synthesis techniques, processes, microstructural control, and unique physical properties of materials in nanodimensions.
                  <br/>
                  Nanowires, quantum dots, thin films, electrical transport, mechanical behavior, and technical applications of nanomaterials
                  <br/>
                  Chemical interactions, classical and statistical thermodynamics of small systems.
                  <br/>
                  Carbon-based nanomaterials, supramolecular chemistry, liquid crystals, colloid and polymer chemistry, surface functionalization, catalysis.
                  <br/>
                  Nanoscale detection methods.
                  <br/>
                  Understanding nanotechnology, broad implications, miniaturization.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   EVALUATION
                  </strong>
                 </p>
                 <ul>
                  <li>
                   <strong>
                    Type:
                   </strong>
                   written examination; project evaluation.
                  </li>
                  <li>
                   <strong>
                    Description:
                   </strong>
                   Training will be completed by projects and specific seminars. The assessment will take place through oral tests and project reports.
                   <br/>
                   For the oral test the competent use of a scientific language, the ability to synthesize, the clarity of exposition.
                   <br/>
                   The oral exam consists in three theoretical questions (each contributes with 10/30 to the final vote). The exam evaluates the overall preparation of the student, the ability to integrate the knowledge of the different parts of the program, the consequentiality of the reasoning, the analytical ability and the autonomy of judgment. Furthermore, language properties and clarity of presentation are assessed, in compliance with the Dublin descriptors (1. Knowledge and understanding; 2. Ability to apply knowledge and understanding; 3 . Making judgments; 4. Learning skills; 5: Communication skills).
                   <br/>
                   The final vote of the exam is expressed out of thirty and will be obtained through the following graduation system:
                   <br/>
                   Not pass: important deficiencies and / or inaccuracies in the knowledge and understanding of the topics; limited capacity for analysis and synthesis, frequent generalizations and limited critical and judgment skills, the arguments are presented in an inconsistent way and with inappropriate language,
                   <br/>
                   18-20: just sufficient knowledge and understanding of the topics with possible generalizations and imperfections; sufficient capacity for analysis, synthesis and autonomy of judgment, the topics are frequently exposed in an inconsistent way and with inappropriate / technical language,
                   <br/>
                   21-23: Routine knowledge and understanding of topics; ability to analyze and synthesize with sufficiently coherent logical argument and appropriate / technical language
                   <br/>
                   24-26: Fair knowledge and understanding of the topics; good analysis and synthesis skills with rigorously expressed arguments but with a language that is not always appropriate / technical.
                   <br/>
                   27-29: Complete knowledge and understanding of the topics; remarkable abilities of analysis and synthesis. Good autonomy of judgment. Topics exposed rigorously and with appropriate / technical language
                   <br/>
                   30-30L: Excellent level of knowledge and in-depth understanding of the topics. Excellent skills of analysis, synthesis and autonomy of judgment. Arguments expressed in an original way and with appropriate technical language.
                  </li>
                 </ul>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   ADOPTED TEXTS
                   <br/>
                  </strong>
                  Literature articles delivered in class.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   DELIVERY MODE (Presence/e-learning)
                  </strong>
                  <br/>
                  Precence.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   TEACHING METHODS
                   <br/>
                  </strong>
                  Different teaching approaches will be used during the course. Teacher-centered approach will be applied in teaching fundamental skills across the chemical areas. Student learning will be measured through written tests.
                  <br/>
                  The student-centered approach will be applied during the classroom exercises. Here students will play an active and participatory role in their learning process. Student learning will be measured through both formal (final exam) and informal (class discussions) assessment forms.
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>

      <div class="content-area wpex-clr" id="primary">
       <div class="site-content wpex-clr" id="content">
        <article class="single-page-article wpex-clr" id="single-blocks">
         <div class="single-page-content single-content entry wpex-clr">
          <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
           <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
            <div class="vc_column-inner">
             <div class="wpb_wrapper">
              <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <p>
                 The programme philosophy is that the internationalization must be amplified by the cultural and social activities. The local language courses and local culture courses combined with visits in local culture and history related places are part of the long-lasting cultural effects and are proposed in each partner country: in France, students learn about Roman time in Provence, in Wroclaw, about the rich and dynamic history of Central Europe, in Rome, about the origins of the European civilization.
                </p>
                <p>
                 We propose also one day integration activity, during the welcome week in Marseille, animated by the local theatre.
                </p>
                <p>
                 The first intakes visited the Roman historical sites in Provence (e.g., Pont du Gard) and they had a short winter exploration of the South Alps and its history (Napoleon trail and military citadel monuments).  During the second semester, in Wroclaw, the cultural experience was continued by common evenings in National Music Forum, weekend trips into nearest mountains and historical monuments sightseeing. In Italy, the ancient and modern history of Rome was used to give an additional understanding of our European heritage and history.
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>

					if(e.layout==="fullscreen" || e.l==="fullscreen")
						newh = Math.max(e.mh,window.RSIH);

						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gw[i]===undefined || e.gw[i]===0) e.gw[i] = e.gw[i-1];
						e.gh = e.el===undefined || e.el==="" || (Array.isArray(e.el) && e.el.length==0)? e.gh : e.el;

						var nl = new Array(e.rl.length),
							ix = 0,
							sl;
						e.tabw = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabw;
						e.thumbw = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbw;
						e.tabh = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabh;

						sl = nl[0];

						var m = pw>(e.gw[ix]+e.tabw+e.thumbw) ? 1 : (pw-(e.tabw+e.thumbw)) / (e.gw[ix]);
						newh =  (e.gh[ix] * m) + (e.tabh + e.thumbh);

      function setREVStartSize(e){

					e.tabhide = e.tabhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabhide);
					e.thumbhide = e.thumbhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.thumbhide);
					e.mh = e.mh===undefined || e.mh=="" || e.mh==="auto" ? 0 : parseInt(e.mh,0);
					if(e.layout==="fullscreen" || e.l==="fullscreen")
						newh = Math.max(e.mh,window.RSIH);
					else{
						e.gw = Array.isArray(e.gw) ? e.gw : [e.gw];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gw[i]===undefined || e.gw[i]===0) e.gw[i] = e.gw[i-1];
						e.gh = e.el===undefined || e.el==="" || (Array.isArray(e.el) && e.el.length==0)? e.gh : e.el;
						e.gh = Array.isArray(e.gh) ? e.gh : [e.gh];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gh[i]===undefined || e.gh[i]===0) e.gh[i] = e.gh[i-1];
											
						var nl = new Array(e.rl.length),
							ix = 0,
							sl;
						e.tabw = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabw;
						e.thumbw = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbw;
						e.tabh = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabh;
						e.thumbh = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbh;
						for (var i in e.rl) nl[i] = e.rl[i]<window.RSIW ? 0 : e.rl[i];
						sl = nl[0];
						for (var i in nl) if (sl>nl[i] && nl[i]>0) { sl = nl[i]; ix=i;}
						var m = pw>(e.gw[ix]+e.tabw+e.thumbw) ? 1 : (pw-(e.tabw+e.thumbw)) / (e.gw[ix]);
						newh =  (e.gh[ix] * m) + (e.tabh + e.thumbh);
					}
					var el = document.getElementById(e.c);
					if (el!==null && el) el.style.height = newh+"px";
					el = document.getElementById(e.c+"_wrapper");
					if (el!==null && el) {
						el.style.height = newh+"px";
						el.style.display = "block";
					}

              </h2>
              <div class="vcex-module vcex-divider vcex-divider-solid wpex-max-w-100 wpex-mx-auto wpex-block wpex-h-0 wpex-border-b wpex-border-solid wpex-border-main" style="margin-top:20px;margin-bottom:20px;border-color:#e0e0e0;">
              </div>
              <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <p>
                 The Aix Marseille University is a world leader in the research of nano-porous systems and adsorption in porous materials. The laboratory MADIREL (Department of Chemistry) is known internationally for its competences in characterization of nano-porous materials and dispersed systems, in thermodynamics of adsorption and in electrochemistry of solids and in solution, experimentally and numerically.
                 <br/>
                 The conducted research domains are related to many technological problems, including storage, capture and separation of hydrogen, methane, carbon dioxide, nanomaterials and electrochemical energy technologies. The Marseille partner has developed strong research cooperation with University of Missouri, University of Montpellier, and with Turin Polytechnic University in Tashkent, Uzbekistan and with the Partners from Wroclaw and Rome. New cooperation programs are under development with University in Seville, in Fortaleza and with the University of Queensland.
                </p>

              <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <p>
                 The Wroclaw University of Science and Technology is an engineering school having very rich research programs in nanoscience. Many of them are characterized by bio-applications: bioreactor processes, bio-membrane separations, bio-photonics. These bio-aspects and engineering profile of nano-science is an important contribution for this Joint Master project, because the mechanisms of nano-engineering have been first observed in biological systems. Wroclaw has also a long history of numerical modeling research in this area which is an important part of our study program objectives. The Polish Partner has cooperation programs with Lvov in Ukraine, with the University of Missouri and with the Partner from Marseille.
                </p>

              <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <p>
                 The University of Rome Tor Vergata is strongly committed to promoting the international dimension of studies and research. In line with this objective, 16 degree programs are “international” and the majority of Doctoral programs are offered in English. “Tor Vergata” is developing multiple lines of work with the aim of promoting “social innovation and growth of the territory”. The Department of Industrial Engineering has excellent credentials in nano-phase separated membranes for electrochemical energy technologies, in nano-fluidics, in technological aspects of smart polymers, and in the preparation and testing of materials organized into micro-and nano-systems. The Department is considered a leader in the transfer of technology to industry which is considered a strategic aspect of nano-engineering. It has strong cooperation programs with the Northeastern University in Boston and with Aix Marseille University.

      function setREVStartSize(e){

					e.tabhide = e.tabhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabhide);
					e.thumbhide = e.thumbhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.thumbhide);
					e.mh = e.mh===undefined || e.mh=="" || e.mh==="auto" ? 0 : parseInt(e.mh,0);
					if(e.layout==="fullscreen" || e.l==="fullscreen")
						newh = Math.max(e.mh,window.RSIH);
					else{
						e.gw = Array.isArray(e.gw) ? e.gw : [e.gw];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gw[i]===undefined || e.gw[i]===0) e.gw[i] = e.gw[i-1];
						e.gh = e.el===undefined || e.el==="" || (Array.isArray(e.el) && e.el.length==0)? e.gh : e.el;
						e.gh = Array.isArray(e.gh) ? e.gh : [e.gh];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gh[i]===undefined || e.gh[i]===0) e.gh[i] = e.gh[i-1];
											
						var nl = new Array(e.rl.length),
							ix = 0,
							sl;
						e.tabw = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabw;
						e.thumbw = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbw;
						e.tabh = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabh;
						e.thumbh = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbh;
						for (var i in e.rl) nl[i] = e.rl[i]<window.RSIW ? 0 : e.rl[i];
						sl = nl[0];
						for (var i in nl) if (sl>nl[i] && nl[i]>0) { sl = nl[i]; ix=i;}
						var m = pw>(e.gw[ix]+e.tabw+e.thumbw) ? 1 : (pw-(e.tabw+e.thumbw)) / (e.gw[ix]);
						newh =  (e.gh[ix] * m) + (e.tabh + e.thumbh);
					}
					var el = document.getElementById(e.c);
					if (el!==null && el) el.style.height = newh+"px";
					el = document.getElementById(e.c+"_wrapper");
					if (el!==null && el) {
						el.style.height = newh+"px";
						el.style.display = "block";
					}

					e.thumbhide = e.thumbhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.thumbhide);
					e.mh = e.mh===undefined || e.mh=="" || e.mh==="auto" ? 0 : parseInt(e.mh,0);
					if(e.layout==="fullscreen" || e.l==="fullscreen")
						newh = Math.max(e.mh,window.RSIH);
					else{
						e.gw = Array.isArray(e.gw) ? e.gw : [e.gw];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gw[i]===undefined || e.gw[i]===0) e.gw[i] = e.gw[i-1];
						e.gh = e.el===undefined || e.el==="" || (Array.isArray(e.el) && e.el.length==0)? e.gh : e.el;
						e.gh = Array.isArray(e.gh) ? e.gh : [e.gh];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gh[i]===undefined || e.gh[i]===0) e.gh[i] = e.gh[i-1];
											
						var nl = new Array(e.rl.length),
							ix = 0,
							sl;
						e.tabw = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabw;
						e.thumbw = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbw;
						e.tabh = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabh;
						e.thumbh = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbh;
						for (var i in e.rl) nl[i] = e.rl[i]<window.RSIW ? 0 : e.rl[i];
						sl = nl[0];
						for (var i in nl) if (sl>nl[i] && nl[i]>0) { sl = nl[i]; ix=i;}
						var m = pw>(e.gw[ix]+e.tabw+e.thumbw) ? 1 : (pw-(e.tabw+e.thumbw)) / (e.gw[ix]);
						newh =  (e.gh[ix] * m) + (e.tabh + e.thumbh);
					}
					var el = document.getElementById(e.c);
					if (el!==null && el) el.style.height = newh+"px";
					el = document.getElementById(e.c+"_wrapper");

     <div class="container wpex-clr" id="content-wrap">
      <div class="content-area wpex-clr" id="primary">
       <div class="site-content wpex-clr" id="content">
        <article class="single-page-article wpex-clr" id="single-blocks">
         <div class="single-page-content single-content entry wpex-clr">
          <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
           <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
            <div class="vc_column-inner">
             <div class="wpb_wrapper">
              <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <p>
                 <strong>
                  Erasmus Mundus Joint Master
                 </strong>
                 (EMJM) scholarships are available for visiting researchers who want to carry out teaching assignments and research projects for the Erasmus Mundus Masters in Chemical Nanoengineering. Scholarships can be awarded to guest lecturers from any country, who bring added value to the student intake in terms of student-centred teaching/lecturing and related activities. They will be selected by the CNE consortium to contribute to the joint programme within the Partner institutions.
                </p>
                <p>
                 EMJM scholars holding an Erasmus Mundus scholarship will:
                </p>
                <ol>
                 <li>
                  Commit themselves to actively participate in the masters course activities;
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  Spend a minimum of 1 week in any partner institution;
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  Perform teaching/research/student tutoring activities in at least one of the partner institution;
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  Contribute, after their visiting scholar activities, to the promotion and dissemination of the Erasmus Mundus Programme in their university and country of origin.
                 </li>
                </ol>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear" style="height:10px;">
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-module wpex-alert wpex-alert-warning">
               Scholars can apply to the program for a stay of 1 week minimum and 3 weeks maximum in one of the partners institutions (Marseille, Rome, Wroclaw). The amount of the scholarship is fixed at
               <strong>
                2,000 €
               </strong>
               for the first week of the visit if the scholar is coming from any country outside of Europe, and at
               <strong>
                1,500 €
               </strong>
               for the first week of the visit if the scholar is coming from any European countries. The scholarship of
               <strong>
                1,000 €/week
               </strong>
               is to be granted for each following week of the scholar’s visit.
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear" style="height:20px;">
              </div>
              <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <p>
                 Please send a CV with a teaching project (1 page) describing your possible contribution (teaching / student tutoring) to
                 <strong>
                  Professor Philippe Knauth
                 </strong>
                 at mail
                 <strong>
                  philippe.knauth@univ-amu.fr
                 </strong>
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear">
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>

     <script>
      function setREVStartSize(e){
			//window.requestAnimationFrame(function() {
				window.RSIW = window.RSIW===undefined ? window.innerWidth : window.RSIW;
				window.RSIH = window.RSIH===undefined ? window.innerHeight : window.RSIH;
				try {
					var pw = document.getElementById(e.c).parentNode.offsetWidth,
						newh;
					pw = pw===0 || isNaN(pw) || (e.l=="fullwidth" || e.layout=="fullwidth") ? window.RSIW : pw;
					e.tabw = e.tabw===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabw);
					e.thumbw = e.thumbw===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.thumbw);
					e.tabh = e.tabh===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabh);
					e.thumbh = e.thumbh===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.thumbh);
					e.tabhide = e.tabhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabhide);
					e.thumbhide = e.thumbhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.thumbhide);
					e.mh = e.mh===undefined || e.mh=="" || e.mh==="auto" ? 0 : parseInt(e.mh,0);
					if(e.layout==="fullscreen" || e.l==="fullscreen")
						newh = Math.max(e.mh,window.RSIH);
					else{
						e.gw = Array.isArray(e.gw) ? e.gw : [e.gw];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gw[i]===undefined || e.gw[i]===0) e.gw[i] = e.gw[i-1];
						e.gh = e.el===undefined || e.el==="" || (Array.isArray(e.el) && e.el.length==0)? e.gh : e.el;
						e.gh = Array.isArray(e.gh) ? e.gh : [e.gh];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gh[i]===undefined || e.gh[i]===0) e.gh[i] = e.gh[i-1];
											
						var nl = new Array(e.rl.length),
							ix = 0,
							sl;
						e.tabw = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabw;
						e.thumbw = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbw;
						e.tabh = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabh;
						e.thumbh = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbh;
						for (var i in e.rl) nl[i] = e.rl[i]<window.RSIW ? 0 : e.rl[i];
						sl = nl[0];
						for (var i in nl) if (sl>nl[i] && nl[i]>0) { sl = nl[i]; ix=i;}
						var m = pw>(e.gw[ix]+e.tabw+e.thumbw) ? 1 : (pw-(e.tabw+e.thumbw)) / (e.gw[ix]);
						newh =  (e.gh[ix] * m) + (e.tabh + e.thumbh);
					}
					var el = document.getElementById(e.c);
					if (el!==null && el) el.style.height = newh+"px";
					el = document.getElementById(e.c+"_wrapper");
					if (el!==null && el) {
						el.style.height = newh+"px";
						el.style.display = "block";
					}
				} catch(e){
					console.log("Failure at Presize of Slider:" + e)
				}
			//});
		  };

                  </li>

                  </li>
                  <li>
                   A good command of English must be certified (minimum language requirements: IELTS 6,2 or TOEFL iBT 91)
                  </li>
                 </ul>

      function setREVStartSize(e){

					e.tabhide = e.tabhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabhide);
					e.thumbhide = e.thumbhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.thumbhide);
					e.mh = e.mh===undefined || e.mh=="" || e.mh==="auto" ? 0 : parseInt(e.mh,0);
					if(e.layout==="fullscreen" || e.l==="fullscreen")
						newh = Math.max(e.mh,window.RSIH);
					else{
						e.gw = Array.isArray(e.gw) ? e.gw : [e.gw];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gw[i]===undefined || e.gw[i]===0) e.gw[i] = e.gw[i-1];
						e.gh = e.el===undefined || e.el==="" || (Array.isArray(e.el) && e.el.length==0)? e.gh : e.el;
						e.gh = Array.isArray(e.gh) ? e.gh : [e.gh];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gh[i]===undefined || e.gh[i]===0) e.gh[i] = e.gh[i-1];
											
						var nl = new Array(e.rl.length),
							ix = 0,
							sl;
						e.tabw = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabw;
						e.thumbw = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbw;
						e.tabh = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabh;
						e.thumbh = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbh;
						for (var i in e.rl) nl[i] = e.rl[i]<window.RSIW ? 0 : e.rl[i];
						sl = nl[0];
						for (var i in nl) if (sl>nl[i] && nl[i]>0) { sl = nl[i]; ix=i;}
						var m = pw>(e.gw[ix]+e.tabw+e.thumbw) ? 1 : (pw-(e.tabw+e.thumbw)) / (e.gw[ix]);
						newh =  (e.gh[ix] * m) + (e.tabh + e.thumbh);
					}
					var el = document.getElementById(e.c);
					if (el!==null && el) el.style.height = newh+"px";
					el = document.getElementById(e.c+"_wrapper");
					if (el!==null && el) {
						el.style.height = newh+"px";
						el.style.display = "block";
					}

              <div class="vcex-module wpex-alert wpex-alert-info">
               The program offers the possibility of free participation, without tuition fees, for self-financed students.
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
               <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                 <p>
                  A self-financed student will not receive a scholarship. Therefore, she/he must cover the living, accommodation and travel expenses in France (1st semester), Poland (2nd semester) and Italy (3rd semester).
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  A self-funded students will receive:
                 </p>
                 <ul>
                  <li>
                   Medical insurance that includes medical expenses, physical accidents, permanent disability, civil liability and material damage.
                  </li>
                  <li>
                   Free access to all activities included in the program (summer school, cultural and sports activities, language courses etc.).
                  </li>
                  <li>
                   Free access to electronic systems and laboratories of the universities.
                   <br/>
                   Administrative support.
                  </li>
                  <li>
                   Access to accommodation in a student dormitory (paid as for other students).
                   <br/>
                   Support for the visa application.
                  </li>
                 </ul>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear">
              </div>

						var nl = new Array(e.rl.length),

						newh =  (e.gh[ix] * m) + (e.tabh + e.thumbh);

                  <p>
                   Erasmus Mundus is a co-operation and mobility programme in the field of higher education organised by the European Commission under the broader Erasmus+ program. It aims to enhance the quality of European higher education in order to promote the European Union as a centre of excellence in learning around the world and to promote intercultural understanding through co-operation with third countries as well as for the development of
                   <br/>

              <h5 class="vcex-heading vcex-module wpex-text-2xl wpex-font-normal wpex-m-auto wpex-max-w-100 vcex-heading-bottom-border-w-color wpex-block hidden vc_custom_1727252855727 wpex-border-b-2 wpex-border-solid wpex-border-main" style="font-size:var(--wpex-text-2xl);">
               <span class="vcex-heading-inner wpex-inline-block wpex-clr wpex-relative wpex-pb-5 wpex-border-b-2 wpex-border-solid wpex-border-accent">
                Eligibility to EMJMD Scholarships
               </span>
              </h5>
              <div class="vcex-grid-container vcex-module wpex-grid wpex-gap-20 wpex-grid-cols-1 hidden" style="gap:30px;">
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  What are the lists of Programme and Partner countries?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   The list of countries is provided on the European Agency website:
                   <br/>
                   <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmus-plus/about/who-can-take-part_en" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                    https://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmus-plus/about/who-can-take-part_en
                   </a>
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  Why do I need to provide a proof of residence?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   Distance between your place of origin and the CNE coordinator (Marseille) determines the contribution to travel costs of students that were awarded an EMJMD Scholarship. The proof of residence is thus required to ascertain the place of origin.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  What is a valid proof of residence?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   It is a scanned copy of an official document that certifies your residence and clearly states your actual place of stay.
                   <br/>
                   The document can either be:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    a certificate of residence in line with the provisions of the municipality where the student is registered;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    a certificate confirming the place of employment or study/training, issued by the employer or the institution where the student studies/finished his/her studies.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                  <p>
                   It must be an officially notarized copy in English or an official English translation of the original document and must have been issued within 12 months before the application deadline.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  Can I spend part of the EMJMD Programme in my country of residence? If so, will I continue receiving the scholarship during this period?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   You can spend parts of your studies in your country of residence. However, since the EMJMD Programme aims at supporting studies abroad, the monthly scholarship is interrupted in the following cases:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    when a student spends periods of time in their country of residence (study / research / internship / thesis
                    <br/>
                    preparation);
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    when a student from a Partner country spends more than three months in any Partner country other than
                    <br/>
                    his/her own country of residence.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  How do I apply if I am from a Partner country but I am living in Europe (or in a Programme Country)?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   Check if the 12-month residence rule applies to you. If you are a national from a Partner country and have carried out your main activity (studies, training or work) for more than a total of 12 months over the last 5 years in one or several Programme country(ies), you should apply as Programme country candidate.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   The wording “total of 12 months” refers to all possible cases: a single period in one Programme country, several periods in one Programme country or the sum of different periods in different Programme countries.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   The 5-year reference period is calculated backwards from the EMJMD scholarship application deadline. This 12-month rule does not apply to Partner country candidates who hold refugee status in a Programme country.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   If you are a national from a Partner country and the 12-month residence rule does not apply to you, you should apply as a Partner country candidate.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  I have two nationalities. Under which should I apply for an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD)?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   You have to choose under which nationality you want to apply.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  How many EMJMD can I apply to?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degrees (EMJMDs) are international master programmes delivered by a group of universities from different countries with specific expertise and interest in the study programme. These programmes are based on excellence, and therefore have specific requirements which often respond to specialised profiles.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   While there is no formal restriction in the number of applications a student might submit, we generally recommend to potential applicants to choose carefully the master courses on the basis of the preconditions/selection criteria described on the websites of the respective EMJMDs.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  Do I need to submit a separate application to be considered for EMJMD scholarships?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   No. The same application will be used to decide if you are accepted to the Programme as well as if you are awarded an EMJMD scholarship, depending on your ranking (Main List and Reserve List)
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   We invite you to indicate in the application form whether you would accept to register as self-funded students if not accepted as a scholarship holder.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  If awarded an EMJMD scholarship, can I postpone my intake to the next year?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   No, the grant is awarded for a specific campaign and cannot be postponed.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  I have not been selected for an EMJMD Scholarship. Are there other solutions to finance my studies?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   A few self-funded students may be accepted (in addition to the ones that were awarded an EMJMD Scholarships).
                   <br/>
                   Several options may help to handle the tuition fees and other living expenses.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   For instance, if you come from a Program Country, you may apply to the Erasmus+ Master Degree Loan
                   <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmusplus/opportunities/individuals/students/erasmus-plus-master-degree-loans_en" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                    https://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmusplus/opportunities/individuals/students/erasmus-plus-master-degree-loans_en
                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Otherwise, you can check for the public grants or private foundations from your own country
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">

                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">

                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">

                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">

               <span class="vcex-heading-inner wpex-inline-block wpex-clr wpex-relative wpex-pb-5 wpex-border-b-2 wpex-border-solid wpex-border-accent">

               </span>
              </h5>
              <div class="vcex-grid-container vcex-module wpex-grid wpex-gap-20 wpex-grid-cols-1" style="gap:30px;">
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  I do not have a passport; may I use another ID number in my application form?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   Yes, you can use that during the application process. Nevertheless, if you are selected and you do not have an EU id card, you need to provide a valid passport.
                  </p>

               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  I have a passport that is not 12 months valid when arriving in the host country. That means I should apply for the extension of my passport validity to fulfil the requirement. Can I proceed with my application process with the existing passport?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>

                  </p>

               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">

                  </p>

                </div>

               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  If selected, which visa do I need to provide to join the programme?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   You will need to apply for a French Visa (student mobility visa with the possibility to apply for a French residence permit during your stay in Marseille).
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear" style="height:40px;">

              <h5 class="vcex-heading vcex-module wpex-text-2xl wpex-font-normal wpex-m-auto wpex-max-w-100 vcex-heading-bottom-border-w-color wpex-block vc_custom_1666712990324 wpex-border-b-2 wpex-border-solid wpex-border-main" style="font-size:var(--wpex-text-2xl);">
               <span class="vcex-heading-inner wpex-inline-block wpex-clr wpex-relative wpex-pb-5 wpex-border-b-2 wpex-border-solid wpex-border-accent">
                English Proficiency
               </span>
              </h5>
              <div class="vcex-grid-container vcex-module wpex-grid wpex-gap-20 wpex-grid-cols-1" style="gap:30px;">
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  Is there any minimum score required for the TOEFL or IETLS tests?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   Official certificates are expected: a CEFRL B2 level, or a similar test, such as IELTS (6,5) or TOEFL (IBT 91).
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  If I have been enrolled in an English teaching programme before, do I still have to submit a TOEFL or IELTS certificate?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   No. In that case, a certificate from the institution where you have taken the English teaching programme or any other proof of English teaching programme will be sufficient.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  I will receive my TOEFL or IETLS certificate only after the deadline of application, what should I do?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   No, you need to provide a copy of the certificate or a proof that your degree was taught in English.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear">
              </div>
              <h5 class="vcex-heading vcex-module wpex-text-2xl wpex-font-normal wpex-m-auto wpex-max-w-100 vcex-heading-bottom-border-w-color wpex-block vc_custom_1666713103783 wpex-border-b-2 wpex-border-solid wpex-border-main" style="font-size:var(--wpex-text-2xl);">
               <span class="vcex-heading-inner wpex-inline-block wpex-clr wpex-relative wpex-pb-5 wpex-border-b-2 wpex-border-solid wpex-border-accent">
                Register and login on application platform
               </span>
              </h5>
              <div class="vcex-grid-container vcex-module wpex-grid wpex-gap-20 wpex-grid-cols-1" style="gap:30px;">
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  I have not received any email to activate my account. What should I do?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   First of all, register to the application platform using an email address that do not use any filtering system (such as boxbe, …). Indeed, most of the emails will be automatically sent to you by our application, and if your messaging system rejects these emails, we have no way to send them again.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Check also in the spam box using the webmail and/or an email client.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   As a last resort, renew your password at
                   <a href="https://application.master-cne.eu/reset-password">
                    https://application.master-cne.eu/reset-password
                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Try to avoid creating a second application file.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear" style="height:40px;">
              </div>
              <h5 class="vcex-heading vcex-module wpex-text-2xl wpex-font-normal wpex-m-auto wpex-max-w-100 vcex-heading-bottom-border-w-color wpex-block vc_custom_1666713240371 wpex-border-b-2 wpex-border-solid wpex-border-main" style="font-size:var(--wpex-text-2xl);">
               <span class="vcex-heading-inner wpex-inline-block wpex-clr wpex-relative wpex-pb-5 wpex-border-b-2 wpex-border-solid wpex-border-accent">

               </span>
              </h5>
              <div class="vcex-grid-container vcex-module wpex-grid wpex-gap-20 wpex-grid-cols-1" style="gap:30px;">
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">

                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  Can a student who will graduate in June of the coming year, apply?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   Yes, of course! We know that most students who apply are currently enrolled for their last year or session of a BSc or BEng Programme (or equivalent). In this case the diploma will be requested after selection. Please provide a certificate from your University about your current status and the planned date of graduation.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">

                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  In the application file, what is the accepted language for diplomas and grades translation?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   To apply, diplomas and grades have to be translated in English. If accepted, the candidates will also have to provide a translation in French of her/his birth certificate and last diploma to enrol.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  Which topic should be covered by an essay on nano-engineering required in the application?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   Write your own opinion on nanoengineering and nanotechnology. Choose any nanoengineering subject that interest you. No specific structure is required.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  Do we have to confirm the authenticity of document translation from one language to another one by notary service?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   Yes, it is required. All documents must be certified.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">

                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   You should be able to change almost everything in the application documents. You can upload revised versions of the files that you have already uploaded. You can also delete previously submitted files. You can use the “Other document” to send extra information. But you will not be allowed to act on the recommendation letters sent directly by your referents.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Once you have validated your application, it appears as “Sent”, meaning that you cannot change your form. If necessary, you can
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Go to the “Checklist” tab, then submit a new attachment in the “Other document” section.
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Ask us to change minor things. Be very clear in telling us what should be suppressed and what should be added.
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Ask us to put your application back in the “In Progress (not submitted yet)” status. You should then be able to make the corrections by yourself. Please do not forget to validate your application again before the application deadline.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>

              </div>
              <h5 class="vcex-heading vcex-module wpex-text-2xl wpex-font-normal wpex-m-auto wpex-max-w-100 vcex-heading-bottom-border-w-color wpex-block vc_custom_1666713443907 wpex-border-b-2 wpex-border-solid wpex-border-main" style="font-size:var(--wpex-text-2xl);">
               <span class="vcex-heading-inner wpex-inline-block wpex-clr wpex-relative wpex-pb-5 wpex-border-b-2 wpex-border-solid wpex-border-accent">
                Recommendations Letters

              </h5>
              <div class="vcex-grid-container vcex-module wpex-grid wpex-gap-20 wpex-grid-cols-1" style="gap:30px;">
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  The referents I specified did not receive any invitation email.
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   Main instructions are given in the application platform, in the “References” section (top of the page). You are expected to provide the names, status and contact information of (at most) two referents. They will automatically receive an invitation to provide an online recommendation.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Your referents should receive the recommendation request by email as soon as you have filled and closed the “References” form page. If they do not receive the email, it can be due to:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    you have given a wrong email address for your referent.
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    the email has been filtered by your referent’s email system. Tell your referent to check their email spam boxes.
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    the email has been rejected by your referent’s email system (it can be due to a grey listing system, to the use of email protections such as boxbe, …).
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  Can I renew my invitation to my referent(s)?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   As long as your application is in the incomplete status (not yet validated), you can send the request again.
                  </p>

                </div>

                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  How many recommendation letters are needed?

                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   Two recommendations are required.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>

               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  Can I decide where I would like to study or is it mandated for them through the programme?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   Master CNE has a fixed path (1st semester in Marseille, 2nd in Wroclaw, 3rd in Rome, 4th – Master thesis internship, Master thesis defences in Marseille)
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  Can I decide where I do my master thesis?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   A list of Master thesis proposal will be presented to students during their 3rd semester in Rome. You will be requested to choose a topic (and place) from this list as we need to be sure that there are actuals means to do this project.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  What will be my accommodation?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   You will be proposed an accommodation at the university dorms by the local coordinators but you are free to choose your own solution.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
               <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser hidden">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                 <h3 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg" style="font-size:1.38em;">
                  Would I need an insurance during my studies?
                 </h3>
                 <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                  <p>
                   A scholarship holder student will be covered by an insurance policy provided by MARSH. It is a travel insurance in accordance with the “Minimum requirements for the health and accident insurance coverage of EMJMD students”:
                   <a href="https://www.eacea.ec.europa.eu/grants/2014-2020/erasmus/erasmus-mundus-joint-master-degrees-2020_en">

                <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                 <p>
                  After the decisions of the selection have been communicated, applicants have the possibility to appeal against the decision made by the Consortium Selection Committee.
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear" style="height:10px;">
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-module wpex-alert wpex-alert-error">
               Please note that an appeal can only be made against the selection procedure, and not to the outcome of the selection status !
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear" style="height:10px;">
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
               <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                 <p>
                  An appeal should be made by sending an appeal form via registered mail to the CNE Coordinator (postal address: see bottom of the Appeal Form).
                  <br/>
                  The form should state the reason of the appeal, including proof of supporting documents (if applicable).
                  <br/>
                  The appeal has to be sent within 10 working days (with the date of postmark as proof) after receipt of the selection results.
                  <br/>
                  Once the CNE Coordinator receives the appeal form, the sender will receive an acknowledgement of receipt by email. The appeal will then be investigated by the CNE Coordinator and Consortium.
                  <br/>
                  Within 15 working days after having received the appeal, the appealer will receive the outcome of the appeal with the reasons for rejection or acceptation.
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>

     <div class="container wpex-clr" id="content-wrap">
      <div class="content-area wpex-clr" id="primary">
       <div class="site-content wpex-clr" id="content">
        <article class="single-page-article wpex-clr" id="single-blocks">
         <div class="single-page-content single-content entry wpex-clr">
          <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
           <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
            <div class="vc_column-inner">
             <div class="wpb_wrapper">
              <h2 class="vcex-heading vcex-module wpex-text-2xl wpex-font-normal wpex-m-auto wpex-max-w-100 vcex-heading-bottom-border-w-color wpex-block vc_custom_1661348793619 wpex-border-b-2 wpex-border-solid wpex-border-main" style="font-size:var(--wpex-text-2xl);">
               <span class="vcex-heading-inner wpex-inline-block wpex-clr wpex-relative wpex-pb-5 wpex-border-b-2 wpex-border-solid wpex-border-accent">
                Steps for admission
               </span>
              </h2>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
           <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
            <div class="vc_column-inner">
             <div class="wpb_wrapper">
              <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
               <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                <h2 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg">
                 STEP 1: Recommendation Letters
                </h2>
                <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                 <p>
                  The competition for an Erasmus Mundus grant is very strong. Therefore, the coordinator asks the student to submit two recommendation letters from an academic professional referee.
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear">
              </div>
              <a aria-label="uploads/2023/09/recommendation-letter-CNE.pdf" class="vcex-button theme-button small inline" href="/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/recommendation-letter-CNE.pdf" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               <span class="theme-button-inner">
                <span class="vcex-icon-wrap theme-button-icon-left">
                 <span aria-hidden="true" class="ticon ticon-file-pdf-o">
                 </span>
                </span>
                Download the Recommendation Letter CNE
               </span>
              </a>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear" style="height:30px;">
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
           <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
            <div class="vc_column-inner">
             <div class="wpb_wrapper">
              <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
               <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                <h2 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg">
                 STEP 2: Verification of compliance with admission criteria
                </h2>
                <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                 <p>
                  Applicants must have:
                 </p>
                 <ul class="maliste">
                  <li>
                   A bachelor or equivalent degree in Science (Chemistry, Physics, Mechanical, Chemical Engineering, Electronic Engineering, Materials Science…)
                  </li>
                  <li>
                   GPA (Grade Point Average) of at least 75% of the scale maximum is required
                  </li>
                  <li>
                   A good command of English must be certified (minimum language requirements: IELTS 6,2 or TOEFL iBT 91)
                  </li>
                 </ul>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear">
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-module wpex-alert wpex-alert-info">
               Candidates/Applicants must be informed that if they are selected (proposed for a scholarship/fellowship, put on the reserve list or enrolled on a self-paying basis) their data may be used for the purposes of evaluating the programmes, efficiently manage the projects, and producing statistics. Data could be made available to the EACEA, the European Commission, the European External Action Service staff, as well as to other stakeholders of the Erasmus+ programme, such as Erasmus+ National Agencies, National Erasmus+ Offices and the Erasmus Mundus Student and Alumni Association.
               <p>
                More info:
                <a href="https://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=OJ:L:2001:008:0001:0022:EN:PDF" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                 Official Journal of the European Communities (PDF)
                </a>
               </p>
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear" style="height:30px;">
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
           <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
            <div class="vc_column-inner">
             <div class="wpb_wrapper">
              <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
               <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                <h2 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg">
                 STEP 3: Document Preparation
                </h2>
                <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                 <p>
                  The Application Checklist shows which documents must be included in a complete application dossier.
                  <br/>
                  Download the checklist now and verify that you have these documents.
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear">
              </div>
              <a class="vcex-button theme-button small inline" href="/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/Check_list.pdf" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank" title="Application Checklist">
               <span class="theme-button-inner">
                <span class="vcex-icon-wrap theme-button-icon-left">
                 <span aria-hidden="true" class="ticon ticon-file-pdf-o">
                 </span>
                </span>
                Download the Application Checklist
               </span>
              </a>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear">
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-module wpex-alert wpex-alert-warning">
               If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to send an e-mail to:
               <strong>
                sciences-master-cne@univ-amu.fr
               </strong>
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear" style="height:30px;">
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
           <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
            <div class="vc_column-inner">
             <div class="wpb_wrapper">
              <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
               <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                <h2 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg">
                 STEP 4: Checking Deadlines
                </h2>
                <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                 <p>
                  The applications for next academic year are open from November 1st to May 18th.
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear">
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-module wpex-alert wpex-alert-warning">
               Selection committee is held in June. Students are immediately informed whether their name is on accepted, reserve or refused lists.
               <br/>
               Waiting list is open until the end of August.
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear" style="height:30px;">
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
           <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
            <div class="vc_column-inner">
             <div class="wpb_wrapper">
              <div class="vcex-module vcex-teaser">
               <div class="vcex-teaser-content">
                <h2 class="vcex-teaser-heading wpex-heading wpex-text-lg">
                 STEP 5: Apply!
                </h2>
                <div class="vcex-teaser-text wpex-mt-10 wpex-last-mb-0 wpex-clr">
                 <p>
                  Apply online via the Application Platform (free of charge)
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear">
              </div>
              <a class="vcex-button theme-button inline" href="https://application.master-cne.eu/index.php?lang=en" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               <span class="theme-button-inner">
                <span class="vcex-icon-wrap theme-button-icon-left">
                 <span aria-hidden="true" class="ticon ticon-external-link">
                 </span>
                </span>
                Go to Application Platform

      function setREVStartSize(e){

						newh;

					e.tabw = e.tabw===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabw);

					e.tabh = e.tabh===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabh);

					e.tabhide = e.tabhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabhide);
					e.thumbhide = e.thumbhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.thumbhide);
					e.mh = e.mh===undefined || e.mh=="" || e.mh==="auto" ? 0 : parseInt(e.mh,0);
					if(e.layout==="fullscreen" || e.l==="fullscreen")
						newh = Math.max(e.mh,window.RSIH);
					else{
						e.gw = Array.isArray(e.gw) ? e.gw : [e.gw];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gw[i]===undefined || e.gw[i]===0) e.gw[i] = e.gw[i-1];
						e.gh = e.el===undefined || e.el==="" || (Array.isArray(e.el) && e.el.length==0)? e.gh : e.el;
						e.gh = Array.isArray(e.gh) ? e.gh : [e.gh];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gh[i]===undefined || e.gh[i]===0) e.gh[i] = e.gh[i-1];
											
						var nl = new Array(e.rl.length),
							ix = 0,
							sl;
						e.tabw = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabw;
						e.thumbw = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbw;
						e.tabh = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabh;
						e.thumbh = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbh;
						for (var i in e.rl) nl[i] = e.rl[i]<window.RSIW ? 0 : e.rl[i];
						sl = nl[0];
						for (var i in nl) if (sl>nl[i] && nl[i]>0) { sl = nl[i]; ix=i;}
						var m = pw>(e.gw[ix]+e.tabw+e.thumbw) ? 1 : (pw-(e.tabw+e.thumbw)) / (e.gw[ix]);
						newh =  (e.gh[ix] * m) + (e.tabh + e.thumbh);
					}
					var el = document.getElementById(e.c);
					if (el!==null && el) el.style.height = newh+"px";
					el = document.getElementById(e.c+"_wrapper");
					if (el!==null && el) {
						el.style.height = newh+"px";
						el.style.display = "block";
					}
