     <div class="container wpex-clr" id="content-wrap">
      <div class="content-area wpex-clr" id="primary">
       <div class="site-content wpex-clr" id="content">
        <article class="single-page-article wpex-clr" id="single-blocks">
         <div class="single-page-content single-content entry wpex-clr">
          <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
           <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
            <div class="vc_column-inner">
             <div class="wpb_wrapper">
              <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <p>
                 This Master Course offers an original
                 <strong>
                  program in the highly innovative domain
                 </strong>
                 of nano-engineering. Skills will be acquired at the strongly
                 <strong>
                  interdisciplinary level
                 </strong>
                 needed to master emerging nano-technologies and to develop original concepts and applications aiming at
                 <strong>
                  novel engineering breakthroughs
                 </strong>
                 in many domains;
                 <strong>
                  biomedical
                 </strong>
                 nanotechnologies,
                 <strong>
                  nanomaterials
                 </strong>
                 or applications for
                 <strong>
                  environment
                 </strong>
                 .
                </p>
                <p>
                 The originality of our program is that it deepens the principles of chemistry and engineering with a special orientation in the field of nanotechnology and a strong address to the
                 <strong>
                  industrial reality
                 </strong>
                 . Another originality of our program is based on the extensively developed courses dealing with
                 <strong>
                  the numerical design and engineering
                 </strong>
                 <strong>
                  applications
                 </strong>
                 of nano-systems. Our program is aimed at methodologies applied to nano-engineering, application-oriented and specifically focused on
                 <strong>
                  chemical synthesis and characterization
                 </strong>
                 . It aims at the methodology of bottom-up designing of nano-systems using
                 <strong>
                  modeling and chemical synthesis at the nano-scale
                 </strong>
                 .
                </p>
                <p>
                 Chemistry for nano-engineering is an innovative field of science and technology which is developing very fast. The 2016 Nobel Prize in Chemistry shows the importance of the research in this area. It has shown that
                 <strong>
                  engineering of the nano-machines is not any more a science-fiction
                 </strong>
                 ; it is just a beginning of new engineering specialty where the nano-systems can be numerically designed and chemically synthesized. These new technologies will create a large demand for specialists in this field.
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
           <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
            <div class="vc_column-inner">
             <div class="wpb_wrapper">
              <h3 class="vcex-heading vcex-module wpex-text-2xl wpex-font-normal wpex-m-auto wpex-max-w-100 vcex-heading-bottom-border wpex-block vc_custom_1657012476639 wpex-border-b wpex-border-solid wpex-border-main" style="font-size:var(--wpex-text-2xl);">
               <span class="vcex-heading-inner wpex-inline-block wpex-clr">
                Competences
               </span>
              </h3>
              <div class="vcex-module vcex-bullets vcex-bullets-check">
               <ul>
                <li>
                 Thorough knowledge of the principles of nano-chemistry and nano-engineering
                </li>
                <li>
                 Thorough knowledge of modelling and numerical simulation methods at multi-scale
                </li>
                <li>
                 Ability to synthesize nano-objects by chemical ways, to characterise and model them, and apply nano-objects particularly in nano-machines, supramolecular assemblies and in medical nano-devices
                </li>
                <li>
                 Capacity to manage and to use nanotechnologies to create new devices
                </li>
                <li>
                 Capacity to promote and to develop scientific and technological innovation
                </li>
                <li>
                 Possibility of making a critical analysis of scientific information
                </li>
                <li>
                 Capacity of technical and economic evaluation of a project of innovation and research
                </li>
                <li>
                 Aptitude to occupy leading positions in science and engineering
                </li>
                <li>
                 Ability to integrate in a professional organisation and develop ethics and responsibility
                </li>
                <li>
                 Capacity to work effectively in a team project
                </li>
               </ul>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid">
           <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
            <div class="vc_column-inner">
             <div class="wpb_wrapper">
              <h3 class="vcex-heading vcex-module wpex-text-2xl wpex-font-normal wpex-m-auto wpex-max-w-100 vcex-heading-bottom-border wpex-block vc_custom_1657012470277 wpex-border-b wpex-border-solid wpex-border-main" style="font-size:var(--wpex-text-2xl);">
               <span class="vcex-heading-inner wpex-inline-block wpex-clr">
                Master Objectives
               </span>
              </h3>
              <div class="vcex-module vcex-bullets vcex-bullets-check">
               <ul>
                <li>
                 Assure an interdisciplinary training in the field of nano-engineering, which includes a profound understanding of the chemistry and the methods of synthesis and characterization of nano-materials and nano-systems
                </li>
                <li>
                 Give the students expertise in numerical modeling to predict the chemical and physical properties at the nano-scale
                </li>
                <li>
                 Train the students to synthesize, characterise and model objects of the nano-world, in order to understand their properties, using disciplinary knowledge of fundamental sciences and transdisciplinary knowledge of nano-sciences
                </li>
                <li>
                 Develop a creative experimental approach to prepare, characterise and model nano-objects (nanostructures, nanomaterials or nano-devices) with unknown properties, or resolve problems related to their identification/application/production
                </li>
                <li>
                 Prepare the students for a career in the field of nanotechnology, by offering them a robust experience in this multidisciplinary domain of sciences and engineering
                </li>
                <li>
                 Prepare the students to construct and realize individually or in a team all steps of a research and development project in the domain of nano-sciences et nanotechnologies, mobilising various pluridisciplinary parties
                </li>
                <li>
                 Enable the students to conceive, prepare and use nano-objects in various professional contexts, integrating ethical environmental and societal challenges
                </li>
                <li>
                 Train highly qualified and creative graduates for the labour market with a big capacity to adapt themselves and to find new solutions for technological development (problem solving)
                </li>
                <li>
                 Educate a new generation of engineers who can participate in the creation of new high-technology companies
                </li>
               </ul>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>

      function setREVStartSize(e){
			//window.requestAnimationFrame(function() {
				window.RSIW = window.RSIW===undefined ? window.innerWidth : window.RSIW;
				window.RSIH = window.RSIH===undefined ? window.innerHeight : window.RSIH;
				try {
					var pw = document.getElementById(e.c).parentNode.offsetWidth,
						newh;
					pw = pw===0 || isNaN(pw) || (e.l=="fullwidth" || e.layout=="fullwidth") ? window.RSIW : pw;
					e.tabw = e.tabw===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabw);
					e.thumbw = e.thumbw===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.thumbw);
					e.tabh = e.tabh===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabh);
					e.thumbh = e.thumbh===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.thumbh);
					e.tabhide = e.tabhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabhide);
					e.thumbhide = e.thumbhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.thumbhide);
					e.mh = e.mh===undefined || e.mh=="" || e.mh==="auto" ? 0 : parseInt(e.mh,0);
					if(e.layout==="fullscreen" || e.l==="fullscreen")
						newh = Math.max(e.mh,window.RSIH);
					else{
						e.gw = Array.isArray(e.gw) ? e.gw : [e.gw];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gw[i]===undefined || e.gw[i]===0) e.gw[i] = e.gw[i-1];
						e.gh = e.el===undefined || e.el==="" || (Array.isArray(e.el) && e.el.length==0)? e.gh : e.el;
						e.gh = Array.isArray(e.gh) ? e.gh : [e.gh];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gh[i]===undefined || e.gh[i]===0) e.gh[i] = e.gh[i-1];
											
						var nl = new Array(e.rl.length),
							ix = 0,
							sl;
						e.tabw = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabw;
						e.thumbw = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbw;
						e.tabh = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabh;
						e.thumbh = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbh;
						for (var i in e.rl) nl[i] = e.rl[i]<window.RSIW ? 0 : e.rl[i];
						sl = nl[0];
						for (var i in nl) if (sl>nl[i] && nl[i]>0) { sl = nl[i]; ix=i;}
						var m = pw>(e.gw[ix]+e.tabw+e.thumbw) ? 1 : (pw-(e.tabw+e.thumbw)) / (e.gw[ix]);
						newh =  (e.gh[ix] * m) + (e.tabh + e.thumbh);
					}
					var el = document.getElementById(e.c);
					if (el!==null && el) el.style.height = newh+"px";
					el = document.getElementById(e.c+"_wrapper");
					if (el!==null && el) {
						el.style.height = newh+"px";
						el.style.display = "block";
					}
				} catch(e){
					console.log("Failure at Presize of Slider:" + e)
				}
			//});

              <h2 class="vcex-heading vcex-module wpex-text-2xl wpex-font-normal wpex-m-auto wpex-max-w-100 vcex-heading-plain wpex-block" style="font-size:2em;font-weight:900;">
               <span class="vcex-heading-inner wpex-inline-block wpex-clr">
                The Aix Marseille University
               </span>
              </h2>
              <div class="vcex-module vcex-divider vcex-divider-solid wpex-max-w-100 wpex-mx-auto wpex-block wpex-h-0 wpex-border-b wpex-border-solid wpex-border-main" style="margin-top:20px;margin-bottom:20px;border-color:#e0e0e0;">
              </div>
              <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <p>
                 The Aix Marseille University is a world leader in the research of nano-porous systems and adsorption in porous materials. The laboratory MADIREL (Department of Chemistry) is known internationally for its competences in characterization of nano-porous materials and dispersed systems, in thermodynamics of adsorption and in electrochemistry of solids and in solution, experimentally and numerically.
                 <br/>
                 The conducted research domains are related to many technological problems, including storage, capture and separation of hydrogen, methane, carbon dioxide, nanomaterials and electrochemical energy technologies. The Marseille partner has developed strong research cooperation with University of Missouri, University of Montpellier, and with Turin Polytechnic University in Tashkent, Uzbekistan and with the Partners from Wroclaw and Rome. New cooperation programs are under development with University in Seville, in Fortaleza and with the University of Queensland.
                </p>
               </div>

                The Wroclaw University of Science and Technology
               </span>
              </h2>
              <div class="vcex-module vcex-divider vcex-divider-solid wpex-max-w-100 wpex-mx-auto wpex-block wpex-h-0 wpex-border-b wpex-border-solid wpex-border-main" style="margin-top:20px;margin-bottom:20px;border-color:#e0e0e0;">
              </div>
              <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <p>
                 The Wroclaw University of Science and Technology is an engineering school having very rich research programs in nanoscience. Many of them are characterized by bio-applications: bioreactor processes, bio-membrane separations, bio-photonics. These bio-aspects and engineering profile of nano-science is an important contribution for this Joint Master project, because the mechanisms of nano-engineering have been first observed in biological systems. Wroclaw has also a long history of numerical modeling research in this area which is an important part of our study program objectives. The Polish Partner has cooperation programs with Lvov in Ukraine, with the University of Missouri and with the Partner from Marseille.
                </p>

              <h2 class="vcex-heading vcex-module wpex-text-2xl wpex-font-normal wpex-m-auto wpex-max-w-100 vcex-heading-plain wpex-block" style="font-size:2em;font-weight:900;">
               <span class="vcex-heading-inner wpex-inline-block wpex-clr">
                The University of Rome Tor Vergata
               </span>
              </h2>
              <div class="vcex-module vcex-divider vcex-divider-solid wpex-max-w-100 wpex-mx-auto wpex-block wpex-h-0 wpex-border-b wpex-border-solid wpex-border-main" style="margin-top:20px;margin-bottom:20px;border-color:#e0e0e0;">
              </div>
              <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <p>
                 The University of Rome Tor Vergata is strongly committed to promoting the international dimension of studies and research. In line with this objective, 16 degree programs are “international” and the majority of Doctoral programs are offered in English. “Tor Vergata” is developing multiple lines of work with the aim of promoting “social innovation and growth of the territory”. The Department of Industrial Engineering has excellent credentials in nano-phase separated membranes for electrochemical energy technologies, in nano-fluidics, in technological aspects of smart polymers, and in the preparation and testing of materials organized into micro-and nano-systems. The Department is considered a leader in the transfer of technology to industry which is considered a strategic aspect of nano-engineering. It has strong cooperation programs with the Northeastern University in Boston and with Aix Marseille University.
                </p>
               </div>

     <script>
      function setREVStartSize(e){
			//window.requestAnimationFrame(function() {
				window.RSIW = window.RSIW===undefined ? window.innerWidth : window.RSIW;
				window.RSIH = window.RSIH===undefined ? window.innerHeight : window.RSIH;
				try {
					var pw = document.getElementById(e.c).parentNode.offsetWidth,
						newh;
					pw = pw===0 || isNaN(pw) || (e.l=="fullwidth" || e.layout=="fullwidth") ? window.RSIW : pw;
					e.tabw = e.tabw===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabw);
					e.thumbw = e.thumbw===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.thumbw);
					e.tabh = e.tabh===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabh);
					e.thumbh = e.thumbh===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.thumbh);
					e.tabhide = e.tabhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabhide);
					e.thumbhide = e.thumbhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.thumbhide);
					e.mh = e.mh===undefined || e.mh=="" || e.mh==="auto" ? 0 : parseInt(e.mh,0);
					if(e.layout==="fullscreen" || e.l==="fullscreen")
						newh = Math.max(e.mh,window.RSIH);
					else{
						e.gw = Array.isArray(e.gw) ? e.gw : [e.gw];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gw[i]===undefined || e.gw[i]===0) e.gw[i] = e.gw[i-1];
						e.gh = e.el===undefined || e.el==="" || (Array.isArray(e.el) && e.el.length==0)? e.gh : e.el;
						e.gh = Array.isArray(e.gh) ? e.gh : [e.gh];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gh[i]===undefined || e.gh[i]===0) e.gh[i] = e.gh[i-1];
											
						var nl = new Array(e.rl.length),
							ix = 0,
							sl;
						e.tabw = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabw;
						e.thumbw = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbw;
						e.tabh = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabh;
						e.thumbh = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbh;
						for (var i in e.rl) nl[i] = e.rl[i]<window.RSIW ? 0 : e.rl[i];
						sl = nl[0];
						for (var i in nl) if (sl>nl[i] && nl[i]>0) { sl = nl[i]; ix=i;}
						var m = pw>(e.gw[ix]+e.tabw+e.thumbw) ? 1 : (pw-(e.tabw+e.thumbw)) / (e.gw[ix]);
						newh =  (e.gh[ix] * m) + (e.tabh + e.thumbh);
					}
					var el = document.getElementById(e.c);
					if (el!==null && el) el.style.height = newh+"px";
					el = document.getElementById(e.c+"_wrapper");
					if (el!==null && el) {
						el.style.height = newh+"px";
						el.style.display = "block";
					}
				} catch(e){
					console.log("Failure at Presize of Slider:" + e)
				}
			//});
		  };

         <article class="single-content wpex-mt-20 entry wpex-mb-40 wpex-clr" id="staff-single-content" itemprop="text">
          <p>
           Role: programme coordinator (Wrocław); teacher (Nano-engineering Seminar + Project)
          </p>
          <p>
           Associate Professor at Wroclaw University of Science and Technology in the Department of Chemical Engineering and Technology of Polymer and Carbon Materials. Both, DSc and PhD diploma received in chemical sciences in the field of chemical technology.
           <br/>
           Fields of interest and expertise: (1) synthesis, modification, functionalization and characterization of carbon materials (carbon fibre cloth, carbon nanotubes) for electrocatalytic water splitting; (2) formation of porous bio-based carbons for organic and inorganic pollutants removal from wastewater; (3) thermochemical valorisation of biomass or organic waste materials (torrefaction, pyrolysis, gasification); (4) hydro- and solvothermal synthesis and functionalization of carbonaceous materials (sphere carbons, carbon quantum dots).
          </p>
          <p>
           ORCID:
           <a href="https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9214-7901" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
            https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9214-7901
           </a>
          </p>
          <p>
           Researcher ID:C-9652-2018
          </p>
          <p>
           phone: +48 71 320 64 55
           <br/>
           office: building F3 (Gdanska campus), room 126
           <br/>
           <span aria-hidden="true" class="ticon ticon-envelope">
            piotr.rutkowski@pwr.edu.pl
           </span>
          </p>
         </article>

					e.tabhide = e.tabhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabhide);
					e.thumbhide = e.thumbhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.thumbhide);
					e.mh = e.mh===undefined || e.mh=="" || e.mh==="auto" ? 0 : parseInt(e.mh,0);
					if(e.layout==="fullscreen" || e.l==="fullscreen")
						newh = Math.max(e.mh,window.RSIH);
					else{
						e.gw = Array.isArray(e.gw) ? e.gw : [e.gw];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gw[i]===undefined || e.gw[i]===0) e.gw[i] = e.gw[i-1];
						e.gh = e.el===undefined || e.el==="" || (Array.isArray(e.el) && e.el.length==0)? e.gh : e.el;
						e.gh = Array.isArray(e.gh) ? e.gh : [e.gh];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gh[i]===undefined || e.gh[i]===0) e.gh[i] = e.gh[i-1];
											
						var nl = new Array(e.rl.length),
							ix = 0,
							sl;
						e.tabw = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabw;
						e.thumbw = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbw;
						e.tabh = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabh;
						e.thumbh = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbh;
						for (var i in e.rl) nl[i] = e.rl[i]<window.RSIW ? 0 : e.rl[i];
						sl = nl[0];
						for (var i in nl) if (sl>nl[i] && nl[i]>0) { sl = nl[i]; ix=i;}
						var m = pw>(e.gw[ix]+e.tabw+e.thumbw) ? 1 : (pw-(e.tabw+e.thumbw)) / (e.gw[ix]);
						newh =  (e.gh[ix] * m) + (e.tabh + e.thumbh);
					}
					var el = document.getElementById(e.c);
					if (el!==null && el) el.style.height = newh+"px";
					el = document.getElementById(e.c+"_wrapper");
					if (el!==null && el) {
						el.style.height = newh+"px";
						el.style.display = "block";
					}
				} catch(e){

				}

         <article class="single-content wpex-mt-20 entry wpex-mb-40 wpex-clr" id="staff-single-content" itemprop="text">
          <p>
           Nano Scale Synthesis Methods
           <br/>
           Nano-Engineering Seminar+Project
          </p>
          <p>
           Maria Luisa Di Vona is Professor in Chemistry at the Department of Industrial Engineering, Rome Tor Vergata University. Responsible of the Laboratory of Ionomer Materials for Energy. Italian Coordinator of the Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree “Chemical Nano-Engineering”.
           <br/>
           Main research topics: solid state ionic conductors, synthesis of carbon materials, water treatment. She is author of about 170 publications in international journals.
          </p>
          <p>
           <span aria-hidden="true" class="ticon ticon-envelope">
            divona@uniroma2.it
           </span>
          </p>
         </article>

      function setREVStartSize(e){

					e.tabhide = e.tabhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabhide);
					e.thumbhide = e.thumbhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.thumbhide);
					e.mh = e.mh===undefined || e.mh=="" || e.mh==="auto" ? 0 : parseInt(e.mh,0);
					if(e.layout==="fullscreen" || e.l==="fullscreen")
						newh = Math.max(e.mh,window.RSIH);
					else{
						e.gw = Array.isArray(e.gw) ? e.gw : [e.gw];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gw[i]===undefined || e.gw[i]===0) e.gw[i] = e.gw[i-1];
						e.gh = e.el===undefined || e.el==="" || (Array.isArray(e.el) && e.el.length==0)? e.gh : e.el;
						e.gh = Array.isArray(e.gh) ? e.gh : [e.gh];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gh[i]===undefined || e.gh[i]===0) e.gh[i] = e.gh[i-1];
											
						var nl = new Array(e.rl.length),
							ix = 0,
							sl;
						e.tabw = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabw;
						e.thumbw = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbw;
						e.tabh = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabh;
						e.thumbh = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbh;
						for (var i in e.rl) nl[i] = e.rl[i]<window.RSIW ? 0 : e.rl[i];
						sl = nl[0];
						for (var i in nl) if (sl>nl[i] && nl[i]>0) { sl = nl[i]; ix=i;}
						var m = pw>(e.gw[ix]+e.tabw+e.thumbw) ? 1 : (pw-(e.tabw+e.thumbw)) / (e.gw[ix]);
						newh =  (e.gh[ix] * m) + (e.tabh + e.thumbh);
					}
					var el = document.getElementById(e.c);
					if (el!==null && el) el.style.height = newh+"px";
					el = document.getElementById(e.c+"_wrapper");
					if (el!==null && el) {
						el.style.height = newh+"px";
						el.style.display = "block";

         <article class="single-content wpex-mt-20 entry wpex-mb-40 wpex-clr" id="staff-single-content" itemprop="text">
          <p>
           Italian administrative coordinator
          </p>
          <p>
           Cinzia is an independent researcher working on gender studies in the interdisciplinary field of media studies and translation studies. Cinzia has collaborated and collaborates with the Department of Sociology at Roma Tre and the Netherlands Research School of Gender Studies in Utrecht. At the same time, Cinzia is a university lecturer in English Language at La Sapienza University and administrative coordinator at the University of Rome Tor Vergata, Department of Industrial Engineering for the Erasmus Mundus Master in Chemical Nano-Engineering and coordinator of PhD students in Industrial Engineering at the University of Rome Tor Vergata.
          </p>
          <p>
           <span aria-hidden="true" class="ticon ticon-envelope">
            cinzia.forte@uniroma2.it
           </span>
          </p>
         </article>

						var nl = new Array(e.rl.length),
							ix = 0,
							sl;
						e.tabw = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabw;
						e.thumbw = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbw;

     <script>
      function setREVStartSize(e){
			//window.requestAnimationFrame(function() {
				window.RSIW = window.RSIW===undefined ? window.innerWidth : window.RSIW;
				window.RSIH = window.RSIH===undefined ? window.innerHeight : window.RSIH;
				try {
					var pw = document.getElementById(e.c).parentNode.offsetWidth,
						newh;
					pw = pw===0 || isNaN(pw) || (e.l=="fullwidth" || e.layout=="fullwidth") ? window.RSIW : pw;
					e.tabw = e.tabw===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabw);
					e.thumbw = e.thumbw===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.thumbw);
					e.tabh = e.tabh===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabh);
					e.thumbh = e.thumbh===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.thumbh);
					e.tabhide = e.tabhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.tabhide);
					e.thumbhide = e.thumbhide===undefined ? 0 : parseInt(e.thumbhide);
					e.mh = e.mh===undefined || e.mh=="" || e.mh==="auto" ? 0 : parseInt(e.mh,0);
					if(e.layout==="fullscreen" || e.l==="fullscreen")
						newh = Math.max(e.mh,window.RSIH);
					else{
						e.gw = Array.isArray(e.gw) ? e.gw : [e.gw];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gw[i]===undefined || e.gw[i]===0) e.gw[i] = e.gw[i-1];
						e.gh = e.el===undefined || e.el==="" || (Array.isArray(e.el) && e.el.length==0)? e.gh : e.el;
						e.gh = Array.isArray(e.gh) ? e.gh : [e.gh];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gh[i]===undefined || e.gh[i]===0) e.gh[i] = e.gh[i-1];
											
						var nl = new Array(e.rl.length),
							ix = 0,
							sl;
						e.tabw = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabw;
						e.thumbw = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbw;
						e.tabh = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabh;
						e.thumbh = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbh;
						for (var i in e.rl) nl[i] = e.rl[i]<window.RSIW ? 0 : e.rl[i];
						sl = nl[0];
						for (var i in nl) if (sl>nl[i] && nl[i]>0) { sl = nl[i]; ix=i;}
						var m = pw>(e.gw[ix]+e.tabw+e.thumbw) ? 1 : (pw-(e.tabw+e.thumbw)) / (e.gw[ix]);
						newh =  (e.gh[ix] * m) + (e.tabh + e.thumbh);
					}
					var el = document.getElementById(e.c);
					if (el!==null && el) el.style.height = newh+"px";
					el = document.getElementById(e.c+"_wrapper");
					if (el!==null && el) {
						el.style.height = newh+"px";
						el.style.display = "block";
					}
				} catch(e){
					console.log("Failure at Presize of Slider:" + e)
				}
			//});
		  };

						for (var i in e.rl) nl[i] = e.rl[i]<window.RSIW ? 0 : e.rl[i];
						sl = nl[0];
						for (var i in nl) if (sl>nl[i] && nl[i]>0) { sl = nl[i]; ix=i;}
						var m = pw>(e.gw[ix]+e.tabw+e.thumbw) ? 1 : (pw-(e.tabw+e.thumbw)) / (e.gw[ix]);
						newh =  (e.gh[ix] * m) + (e.tabh + e.thumbh);
					}
					var el = document.getElementById(e.c);
					if (el!==null && el) el.style.height = newh+"px";
					el = document.getElementById(e.c+"_wrapper");
					if (el!==null && el) {
						el.style.height = newh+"px";
						el.style.display = "block";
					}
				} catch(e){
					console.log("Failure at Presize of Slider:" + e)
				}
			//});
		  };
     </script>

					if(e.layout==="fullscreen" || e.l==="fullscreen")
						newh = Math.max(e.mh,window.RSIH);

						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gw[i]===undefined || e.gw[i]===0) e.gw[i] = e.gw[i-1];
						e.gh = e.el===undefined || e.el==="" || (Array.isArray(e.el) && e.el.length==0)? e.gh : e.el;
						e.gh = Array.isArray(e.gh) ? e.gh : [e.gh];
						for (var i in e.rl) if (e.gh[i]===undefined || e.gh[i]===0) e.gh[i] = e.gh[i-1];
											
						var nl = new Array(e.rl.length),
							ix = 0,
							sl;
						e.tabw = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabw;
						e.thumbw = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbw;
						e.tabh = e.tabhide>=pw ? 0 : e.tabh;
						e.thumbh = e.thumbhide>=pw ? 0 : e.thumbh;
						for (var i in e.rl) nl[i] = e.rl[i]<window.RSIW ? 0 : e.rl[i];
						sl = nl[0];

						var m = pw>(e.gw[ix]+e.tabw+e.thumbw) ? 1 : (pw-(e.tabw+e.thumbw)) / (e.gw[ix]);
						newh =  (e.gh[ix] * m) + (e.tabh + e.thumbh);

               <span class="vcex-heading-inner wpex-inline-block wpex-clr">
                Do you want to be a sponsor?
               </span>
              </h2>
              <div class="vcex-spacing wpex-w-100 wpex-clear" style="height:30px;">
              </div>
              <div class="wpb_text_column wpex-max-w-100 wpex-mx-auto wpb_content_element" style="width:1000px;">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <p>
                 We welcome contact from your organisation and are happy to discuss any idea which could facilitate the recruitment of CNE students
                 <br/>
                 <strong>
                  There are three main ways
                 </strong>
                 to sponsor and/or become a business partner of the CNE programme.
                </p>
                <ol>
                 <li>
                  <strong>
                   Student Sponsorship program
                  </strong>
                  : Your organization will have the possibility of sponsoring a qualified CNE student selected jointly by your organization and CNE admission and evaluation committee. Full-funding scholarship is named and advertised under your organization name. The relationship between your organization and the student may be defined in the grant admission criteria.
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  <strong>
                   Internship program
                  </strong>
                  : CNE students perform their master thesis placement during the second year (February-June period). You can participate in this program by offering our students an opportunity to perform the internship in your organization. You will have the opportunity to select the candidate.
                 </li>
                 <li>
                  <strong>
                   Supporting the CNE programme
                  </strong>
                  : You can also directly sponsor the CNE program and participate in the Advisory Board
                 </li>
                </ol>
               </div>
